mainText: Do you want to make more money?

responses.answer: Yes
responses.mainText: Do you have any high interest debt? (Interest rate of about 10% or higher)

responses.answer: Yes, high interest debt with a rate around/above 10%
responses.mainText: Yikes! High-interest debt can snowball quickly! I would pay that off right away!

responses.answer: I paid off my credit card debt
No (I have no debt or the interest is below 10%)
responses.mainText: Fantastic! Do you have about 6 months worth of living expenses saved up?

responses.answer: Yes
responses.mainText: Great! Do you have any savings goals for the next five years?

responses.answer: Yes, my first home is within the next 5 years
responses.mainText: Calculate your FHSA contribution room, if you have room then I would buy low risk ETFs and continue investing into them.

responses.answer: I got all the money I need for my house and I'm all set for the next 5 years
I got all the money I need for my house, but I need more within the next 5 years
I got all the money I need for the next five years, I have longer term goals
responses.mainText: Does your employer match RRSP contributions?

responses.answer: Yes
responses.mainText: I'd match your employers contribution and invest into medium risk ETFs.

responses.answer: I've contributed all my employer will match to my RRSP
No
responses.mainText: Are you looking to purchase your first home more than five years from now?

responses.answer: Yes
responses.mainText: Calculate your FHSA contribution room, if you have room I would buy medium risk ETFs.

responses.answer: I've maxed my FHSA contribution room
No, I'm looking to invest for other future goals more than 5 years from now
responses.mainText: Calculate your TFSA contribution room, if you have room then I would buy medium risk ETFs and continue investing into them

responses.answer: I've maxed my TFSA contribution room
responses.mainText: What are you saving for now?

responses.answer: My child's education
responses.mainText: Calculate your RESP contribution room. If you have room, then I would buy medium risk ETFs and continue investing in them.

responses.answer: I maxed out my RESP and have more money to invest
My retirement
responses.mainText: You can check your RRSP contribution limit online by setting up an account with the CRA. You can also call the CRA at 1-800-267-6999. If you have room, then I would buy a few different ETFs and continue investing in them.

responses.answer: I maxed out my RRSP and have more money to invest
I just want more money
responses.mainText: I think you're ready to open a non-registered investment account to continue investing in ETFs.

responses.answer: What next?
responses.mainText: Congratulations, you seem to have a great portfolio! I don't have any more tips for you at this time.

responses.answer: Yes, something other than my first home
responses.mainText: Calculate your TFSA contribution room, if you have room then I would buy low risk ETFs and continue investing into them

responses.answer: I got all the money I need for now, I can wait more than 5 years
I got all the money I need for things within the next 5 years except for my first home
No
responses.mainText: I would save up 6 months worth of living expenses before putting money towards other goals

responses.answer: I've saved up 6 months worth of living expenses
